question: さらに
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are almost exactly the same, but instead of just meaning <kanji>again</kanji>, it also means <vocabulary>furthermore</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>further</vocabulary>. This is one of those good paragraph-starting essay words, but that's not its only use!
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is a bit different from what you learned with the kanji, though. Just think about how <vocabulary>again</vocabulary> he dropped the <ja><reading>皿</reading></ja> (<ja>さら</ja>). Wow, what a screw up. Again and again.
